column2: UTAH DMV TEST
column4: Utah

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: No turns are allowed on this road

column2: 3. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column4: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column6: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column8: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 5. Which shape is a stop sign?
column4: Octagon

column2: 6. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear
column6: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding

column2: 7. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column6: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column8: be ready to brake sharply and stop.

column2: 8. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: typically provide guidance to drivers.
column6: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 9. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
column4: A reflective yellow diamond

column2: 10. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: turn off your engine.
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 11. Alcohol causes:
column4: poor judgment.

column2: 12. When changing lanes, you should not:
column4: signal your intentions early.
column6: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots
column8: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.
column10: check your side and rear view mirrors.

column2: 13. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
column4: Better reflexes

column2: 14. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: on the left shoulder of the road.
column6: near the left edge of the road.
column8: near the right curb or edge of the road.

column2: 15. When driving in winter, you should NOT:
column4: use snow tires on all four wheels of your vehicle.
column8: check your vehicle's antifreeze level and windshield washer fluid.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn is not permitted
column8: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection
column10: A left turn can be made only after stopping

column2: 17. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 18. Drowsy drivers:
column4: are at risk of being involved in a crash.
column6: should drink coffee to stay awake.
column8: can stay awake by opening a window.

column2: 19. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
column4: white

column2: 20. Alcohol:
column4: enhances your ability to see clearly.
column6: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column10: makes it easier to make correct decisions.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Keep to the side indicated by the arrow

column2: 22. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 23. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: indicate HOV lanes.
column8: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.
column10: show which lanes you must use.

column2: 24. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: green; white

column2: 25. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.
column6: call a taxi if you've been drinking.
column8: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
